question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question requires all three parts (a), (b), and (c) to resolve as "Yes" for the overall question to resolve as "Yes". (a) Diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China have been increasing due to territorial disputes in the South China Sea. Given this context, there is a reasonable likelihood that either the Philippines or China may take diplomatic actions such as expulsions or recalls before August 1, 2024. Thus, I would estimate a moderate to high probability for this part, say around 0.6. (b) Joe Biden's political strategy and his public statements have been closely watched, especially as the election approaches. While he has indicated intentions to run, political dynamics can shift rapidly. However, a definitive announcement that he will not accept the nomination seems less likely, given the nature of political campaigns. Therefore, I would estimate a lower probability for this part, around 0.3. (c) Maria Corina Machado, as an opposition leader in Venezuela, faces significant risks from the government, which has a history of imprisoning political opponents. Given the political climate in Venezuela, there is a substantial probability that she could be imprisoned before the specified date. I would estimate this probability to be around 0.7. To find the overall probability that all three events occur, we multiply the individual probabilities together, as they are independent events: P(a and b and c) = P(a) * P(b) * P(c) = 0.6 * 0.3 * 0.7 = 0.126. Thus, the overall probability that all three parts resolve as "Yes" is approximately 0.126.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The likelihood of Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial involves several factors, including the legal strategies of both the defense and prosecution, Trump's own decisions, and the political climate surrounding the case. Given the current political and legal landscape, and the fact that the trial is scheduled for mid-2024, there is still time for developments that could influence this decision. Nonetheless, the overall trend of high-profile defendants testifying in similar circumstances suggests a reasonable probability that Trump will choose to testify.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

(c) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

To assess the probability of all three events occurring before July 1, 2024, we need to evaluate each component separately:

(a) The ICC issuing arrest warrants for Israeli leaders is a politically sensitive issue and depends on various geopolitical factors. To determine the overall probability of all three events happening, we can multiply the individual probabilities together:

P(a) = 0.30
P(b) = 0.40
P(c) = 0.60

Overall probability = P(a) * P(b) * P(c) = 0.30 * 0.40 * 0.60 = 0.072

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Historically, polling averages tend to converge as the election nears, and they can be influenced by various factors such as debates, campaign strategies, economic conditions, and major news events. Taking all these factors into account, I would estimate a moderate probability that Trump's lead will fall within the specified range on the given date.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To estimate the probability that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for COVID, influenza, and RSV will occur within four weeks of their combined peak in the 2023-24 season, we need to consider several factors. 

1. **Historical Trends**: Historically, respiratory viruses like COVID, influenza, and RSV tend to peak around the same time during winter months. The 2023-24 season is expected to follow similar patterns, especially since these viruses often co-circulate.

2. **Timing of Peaks**: The question specifies that the maximum rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV will be measured within a specific timeframe, and typically, these viruses have overlapping peak periods. Given the nature of respiratory viruses, it is likely that their peaks will be close enough to each other to allow for the maximum hospitalization rates to fall within the four-week window.

3. **Data Reporting Delays**: The question also accounts for reporting delays, which is crucial in understanding that the actual peak may be recognized later than it occurs. However, even with these delays, the expectation remains that the peaks will not diverge significantly due to the seasonal nature of these infections.

4. **Public Health Measures**: Current public health measures and vaccination efforts also play a role. If vaccination rates are high, we might expect lower peaks; however, if there is a resurgence or a new variant, peaks could be pronounced and still align closely.

In conclusion, while uncertainties exist due to factors like variant emergence and public health responses, the historical patterns and overlapping nature of these respiratory illnesses suggest a reasonable likelihood that the maximum rates will indeed occur within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question of whether Iran will carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, involves several geopolitical factors. Historically, tensions between Iran and Israel have been high, with Iran often supporting groups that oppose Israel. However, direct attacks attributed to Iran within Israeli territory are less common due to the significant military and intelligence capabilities of Israel. As of October 2023, the situation in the Middle East remains volatile, with various conflicts and proxy wars ongoing. Iran's military strategies often involve indirect confrontations through proxy groups rather than direct attacks. Additionally, the international community, including powers that have influence over Iran, may deter such actions, especially considering the potential for severe retaliation from Israel. While there is a possibility that Iran could attempt a direct attack, the likelihood of it resulting in a deadly incident that meets the criteria (killing at least five individuals) within the specified timeframe is relatively low. The Israeli defense mechanisms and intelligence are robust, making successful attacks challenging. Considering these factors, I estimate that the probability of Iran carrying out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, is not very high.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024, (b) an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To evaluate the probability of all three events occurring, we need to consider the likelihood of each event separately and then combine them.

(a) Iran carrying out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024: Given the ongoing tensions between Iran and Israel, the probability of an attack occurring is relatively high, particularly if we consider the historical context of hostilities in the region. However, the specific requirement of at least five deaths adds some uncertainty. I would estimate this probability at around 0.6.

(b) An armed conflict resulting in deaths between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024: The situation between China and Taiwan has been tense, with increasing military posturing from China. While a full-scale conflict may not be likely, localized skirmishes or military actions could lead to fatalities. Thus, I would estimate this probability at about 0.5.

(c) The Oklahoma City Thunder winning the 2024 NBA Finals: The probability of any specific team winning the NBA Finals can vary widely based on their performance in the regular season and playoffs. As of now, it is difficult to predict, but if we assume they are a competitive team, I would estimate a probability of around 0.1 for them winning the championship.

To calculate the combined probability of all three events occurring, we multiply the individual probabilities:
P(a and b and c) = P(a) * P(b) * P(c) = 0.6 * 0.5 * 0.1 = 0.03.

This suggests that there is a 3% chance that all three events will occur as specified.
